To earn more $ BTC right? Long a swap or future to hedge and earn more Bitcoin. Still with the goal of earning more Bitcoin. Every single trade is to earn Bitcoin.

It's a very valid question, but in the end the $ BTC value is the only thing that matters. You eventually have to move from that alt to Bitcoin. Every exchange is denominated in Bitcoin. When you cash out...if you have less Bitcoin, you have less USD.
As usual Hustle is spot on. You have to trade vs Bitcoin because alt exchanges are denominated in Bitcoin. Maybe in the future this will change in the future when every alt has a USD pair
then your alt went up against $ BTC! and when you eventually want to convert back to dollars, this means you have more Bitcoin to convert back to dollars.

Using USD is fine - just make sure that USD gain is more than $ BTC gained in USD over the holding period. Otherwise, you just sold your Bitcoin for an alt, and eventually you have to sell your alt back to Bitcoin. Then when you sell your Bitcoin for USD -> you get LESS usd.
